tests_grading.conftest module¶

Fixtures for the grading tests.

tests_grading.conftest.RANDOM_SEED: int = 42¶

Random seed for all randomness in the unit tests.

Fixture for a medium-sized dataset.

Fixture for a medium-sized multiclass dataset.

Fixture for a training dataset with a multiclass dataset.

Fixture for a training dataset.

Fixture for a KNeighborsClassifier with 5 neighbors.

Fixture for a KNeighborsClassifier with 5 neighbors for multiclass classification.

Fixture for a KNeighborsClassifier with radius neighbors.

Fixture for a KNeighborsClassifier with 5 neighbors and weighted voting.

tests_grading.test_dependency module¶

Test that the shapiq dependency is installed with at least version 1.3.0.

tests_grading.test_dependency.test_shapiq_version()[source]¶

Test that shapiq is installed with at least version 1.3.0.

tests_grading.test_imputer module¶

Example test case for the Explainer class.

class tests_grading.test_imputer.TestImputers[source]¶

Bases: object

Tests for calling the GaussianImputer and GaussianCopulaImputer with coalitions.

Generate random coalitions for testing.

test_gaussian_can_be_called(data_test, x_explain)[source]¶

Test if GaussianImputer can be called.

Test init of GaussianCopulaImputer.

test_gaussian_imputer_init(data_test, x_explain)[source]¶

Test init of GaussianImputer.

tests_grading.test_imputer.dummy_model(x: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

A dummy model that returns the sum of the features.

Note

This callable is just here that we satisfy the Imputer’s model parameter and tha we can check if the Imputer can be called with coalitions and returns a vector of “predictions”.

Parameters:

x – Input data as a 2D numpy array with shape (n_samples, n_features).

Returns:

A 1D numpy array with the sum of the features for each sample.

tests_grading.test_subset_finding module¶

Example test case for the Explainer class.

tests_grading.test_subset_finding.load_iv(*, instance: Literal['a', 'b', 'c'], large: bool) → InteractionValues[source]¶

Load interaction values for testing subset finding.

Parameters:

  • instance – The instance to load.

  • large – Whether to load the large or medium version of the interaction values. The large version has about 200 players, and the medium version has approximately 50 players.

Returns:

The loaded interaction values.

tests_grading.test_subset_finding.test_if_subset_finding_can_be_called(max_size)[source]¶

Test if GaussianCopulaImputer is a subclass of shapiq’s Imputer class.

tests_grading.test_subset_finding.test_subset_finding(*, instance: Literal['a', 'b', 'c'], large: bool, max_size: int)[source]¶

Test if subset finding works with precomputed interaction values.

tests_grading.utils module¶

Utility functions for the grading tests.

tests_grading.utils.get_random_coalitions(n_features: int, n_coalitions: int = 5, random_seed: int | None = None) → ndarray[source]¶

Generate random coalitions for testing.

Parameters:

  • n_features – Number of features in the dataset.

  • n_coalitions – Number of coalitions to generate.

  • random_seed – Random seed for reproducibility.

Returns:

A boolean array representing the coalitions.

Module contents¶

Collects all tests that need to pass at the end of the project’s history.

Note

More tests will be added in the future.

shapiq-c
